alert.note: Alert for Coastal Broward County; Coastal Miami Dade County; Coastal Palm Beach County; Far South Miami-Dade County; Inland Miami-Dade County; Inland Palm Beach County; Metro Broward County; Metro Palm Beach County; Metropolitan Miami Dade (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 01 at 11:23PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Miami-Dade, Broward and southeastern Palm Beach Counties through 1215 AM EDT... At 1123 PM EDT, National Weather Service meteorologists were tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Hillsboro Beach to Hallandale to near Royal Palm Ranger Station. Movement was east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Miami, Hialeah, Fort Lauderdale, Pembroke Pines, Hollywood, Miramar, Coral Springs, Pompano Beach, Davie, Miami Beach, Plantation, Sunrise, Boca Raton, Deerfield Beach, Delray Beach, Homestead, Tamarac, Margate, Coral Gables and Key Biscayne. LIGHTNING...EXCESSIVE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: These winds can down small tree limbs and branches, and blow around unsecured small objects. Seek shelter in a safe building until the storm passes. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Excessive cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
